audio.transcript: Early Childhood professionals have a natural role as caring and objective individuals with whom parents can discuss their approach to raising their children. Because of this trusted role, professionals have a unique opportunity to help promote the physical, emotional, and social well being of children.

Early childhood professionals can help educate parents on the importance of play by: understanding the barriers to traditional childhood play; discussing with parents the benefits of play; helping parents and caregivers reinforce that play is the way children learn; and encouraging parents to create a safe environment for their child to play and explore.

Because each child will follow his or her own unique developmental path, parents should be reminded that if they have questions about their child's development or their play preferences, they should consult their child's medical provider.
As you explore this topic, you'll see that both parents and professionals have an instrumental role in facilitating play.
